programme.desc: The investigation into a home invasion that ended with two dead leads to a shocking revelation about Detective Rollins.

programme.title: NFL Press Conferences
programme.desc: NFL Press Conferences brings you behind the podium with coaches and players from around the league following Wild Card Weekend during the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: MVP candidates Lamar Jackson and Josh Allen take the field in the AFC Divisional Round, Buffalo prevails on a dropped two-point conversion by Mark Andrews to win 27-25 over the Baltimore Ravens.

programme.title: NFL Throwback
programme.desc: See which NFL superstars were shockingly traded at the peak of their careers.

programme.title: NFL Power Rankings
programme.desc: Hosts Mike Yam and Eric Edholm provide an in-depth look at where each team sits in the weekly ranking of the remaining teams following Wild Card Weekend of the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Goff threw his second touchdown pass with 6:22 left and the Lions beat the Tampa Bay Buccaneers 31-23 in the divisional round on Sunday.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Despite a 15 point fourth quarter from the Indianapolis Colts, the Pittsburgh Steelers ended with 21-18 victory to advance to the AFC title game.

programme.title: NFL Power Rankings
programme.desc: Hosts Mike Yam and Eric Edholm provide an in-depth look at where each team sits in the weekly ranking of the remaining teams following Wild Card Weekend of the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: Move the Sticks
programme.desc: Former NFL scouts Daniel Jeremiah and Bucky Brooks break down the latest news and action around the league from a scout's perspective, alongside NFL player personnel executives.

programme.title: NFL Top 10
programme.desc: Countdown of the ten best performances in games when players were at their best.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Christian McCaffrey capped a game-winning, 69-yard drive by running for his second touchdown with 1:07 to play, and the 49ers held on to beat the Green Bay Packers 24-21 in a divisional-round thriller on Saturday night.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: Patrick Mahomes and Travis Kelce topple Josh Allen and the Bills in another post season classic. The Chiefs move on to the AFC Championship game for the sixth straight year following a Tyler Bass missed kick to tie the game with under two minutes remaining which ended up leading to a 27-24 Kansas City victory.

programme.title: NFL Daily
programme.desc: Gregg Rosenthal and a rotating crew of elite NFL Media co-hosts, including Patrick Claybon, Colleen Wolfe, Steve Wyche, Nick Shook and Jourdan Rodrigue of The Athletic, get you caught up daily on all the NFL news and analysis you need to be smarter and funnier than your friends ahead of the Divisional Round during the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Press Conferences
programme.desc: NFL Press Conferences brings you behind the podium with coaches and players from around the league following Wild Card Weekend during the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: Weekly Game Previews
programme.desc: This weekly series breaks down what you need to know for every NFL matchup ahead of Divisional Round from the 2025 NFL season.

programme.title: NFL Game Re-Airs
programme.desc: The top-seeded Titans take on the fourth-seeded Bengals in this AFC divisional-round tilt. Ja'Marr Chase was targeted earlier and often in that battle, which ended in a seven-point Bengals victory. As time expired, the rookie kicker Evan McPherson booted the game-winning 52-yard field goal to send the Bengals to the AFC Championship Game.

programme.desc: From shocking upsets to blown leads, take a look back at every team's most painful loss.

programme.desc: The Patriots would meet the Raiders in the Divisional Round of the AFC Playoffs and the New England victory was fueled by the controversial Tuck Rule, which consequently launched the Patriots into a dynasty.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Three of NASCAR’s Rising stars are thrown into the fire as they take on the most famous and dangerous track in America - Daytona to kick off the season. Go deep inside the lives of Rajah Caruth, Jesse Love, and Carson Hocevar as they prepare for the biggest race of the season. Who will triumph and who will crash and burn?

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After his disastrous day at Daytona, Carson Hocevar changes his tune and dazzles the NASCAR world with his aggression in Atlanta. Learn more about where Rajah Caruth comes from as well as his philosophy on the peaks and valleys of a NASCAR season. Jesse Love prepares for his NASCAR cup debut on the golf course with fellow driver Connor Zilisch.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: Relive three of the most impactful weeks in Carson Hocevar’s life, where he had a shot to win three races in a row.

programme.title: RISING
programme.desc: After a dreary start to the season, Rajah Caruth claims his second career win in Nashville. Jesse Love relives the most challenging years of his life before returning to his home track in Sonoma. Amidst the August heat in Daytona Beach, Carson Hocevar has one last shot to prove he’s a playoff driver.

programme.title: Through X
programme.desc: Paul Carcaterra heads to Evanston, IL to visit with Northwestern's Izzy Scane. Izzy has been a dominant force for the Wildcats since she first arrived on campus. With a National title, the Tewaaraton Award winner, and record shattering season – she has cemented herself as an all-time great. We also went to Charlottesville, VA to dissect the elite game of Connor Shellenberger: a hometown hero, and arguably the best player in history for the University of Virginia.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Day 2 action in the WSOP Main Event sees Doyle Brunson headline the feature table along with Scott Fischman. Siblings Howard Lederer and Annie Duke are eliminated, along with two previous Main Event champions.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Money day has arrived in the WSOP Main Event with just 277 players remaining on Day 3. Gus Hansen takes center stage on the feature table, and is joined by Daniel Alaei and Dan Harrington while two other previous champions also survive the day.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Just 149 players remain in the 2004 WSOP Main Event, and Mike Matusow headlines the feature table alongside Greg "Fossilman" Raymer and John Esposito. However, it would be John Murphy, Josh Arieh, and Marcel Luske climbing to the top of the leaderboard.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: World Champions Dan Harrington and Chris Ferguson headline the feature table on Day 5 of the WSOP Main Event. The only other former champion wouldn't survive, as Doyle Brunson was eliminated.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #1: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Jeremy Ausmus is the chip leader ahead of Erik Seidel, Jacky Wang, Nick Schulman, Cole Ferraro, Anthony Hu, and Cary Katz, as the final seven players play for the $204,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: Poker Masters
programme.desc: The Event #2: $10,000 No-Limit Hold'em final table is set at the 2022 Poker Masters! Michael Brinkenhoff is the chip leader ahead of Ethan Yau, Alex Foxen, Stephen Song, Masashi Oya, and Dylan DeStefano, as the final six players play for the $197,600 first-place prize.

programme.title: Warren Miller's Playground
programme.desc: The world is our playground and nobody knows that better than the skiers and riders in Warren Miller’s Playground. Join pioneers like Gretchen Bleiler, Bode Miller, Andreas Hatveit, Mathias Roten, Ueli Kestenholz, and numerous others as they travel around the world from Chile all the way to the sand dunes of Dubai, up to Sweden and the peaks of the Swiss Alps. This year’s invigorating action display includes: a rare and insightful segment on ski racing king and perceived industry bad boy, Bode Miller; a trip to Alaska’s untouched Chugach Range with X-Games Gold Medalists, and brothers, Zach and Reggie Crist; unbelievably deep powder in Utah and British Columbia; and astonishing aerial acrobatics from Sweden, and so much more. PLAYGROUND also highlights the future of snowboarding in a segment featuring the youth-infused Burton Smalls Team in which these young prodigies teach us that size truly isn’t everything.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: You Can Tell 'Em I Said It
programme.desc: The excitable comic again proves why he is one of the world’s premiere funnymen, ripping into racial stereotypes, Viagra, the First Lady, and more.

programme.title: Eddie Griffin: Undeniable
programme.desc: Eddie Griffin brings his blunt and undeniable style to this stand-up set about athletes and racial stereotypes, relationships, and human mistakes.

programme.title: Tommy Tiernan: Tomfoolery
programme.desc: Fresh off his role on the hit show Derry Girls, Irish comic Tommy Tiernan riffs on everything from medical exams to his failed career as a priest.

programme.title: Jay Mohr: American Treasure
programme.desc: The popular comedian tells deeply personal stories from his fascinating life and presents his famously funny celebrity impressions and observations.

programme.title: Dino Vigo: All In
programme.desc: A skilled writer, as well as performer-Vigo seems poised to take the comedy world by storm and yet remains remarkably grounded in his approach to his craft.

programme.title: Barry Brewer: Chicago, I'm Home
programme.desc: With over 15 years as a stand-up, Barry Brewer has a lot to say to his sold out crowd at the Studebaker Theater, where he recounts his life.

programme.title: Andy Kaufman: My Breakfast With Blassie
programme.desc: Andy Kaufman plays himself in this parody of "My Dinner With Andre" at an early-morning breakfast with former wrestling champion Fred Blassie.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Controlled Chaos
programme.desc: The ventriloquist comedian provides fresh, hilarious material with his favorite puppets; Walter, Peanut, and two brand new characters.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Arguing With Myself
programme.desc: Join Jeff and his outspoken felt pals: Walter, Peanut, José Jalapeño, Bubba J, and Sweet Daddy Dee for an evening of laughs and observations.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Spark of Insanity
programme.desc: Jeff and his felt friends Walter, Melvin the Superhero Guy, Peanut, and others share their latest and greatest thoughts about our times.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Unhinged in Hollywood
programme.desc: Previously unseen stand-up comedy by Jeff Dunham; sketches that include popular characters; Brad Paisley performs; special appearances by comic Chris Parnell and former UFC champion Chuck Liddell.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Minding the Monsters
programme.desc: The comedian and ventriloquist extraordinaire, along with this felt friends, visits a haunted house where hilarious chaos ensues.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: I'm With Cupid
programme.desc: Ventriloquist and stand-up comedian Jeff Dunham performs an all-Valentine's Day-themed special.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: All Over the Map
programme.desc: A comedy set and travelogue by comedian Jeff Dunham as he and his ventriloquist’s dummies perform globally from Iceland and London to Israel.

programme.title: Jeff Dunham: Achmed Saves America
programme.desc: The world's most incompetent terrorist finds himself whisked away from his homeland and taken to Americaville, USA.

programme.title: Jesus Trejo: Stay at Home Son
programme.desc: First-generation Mexican-American comic Jesus Trejo is here with jokes and riffs about growing up in L.A. County and other hilarious facts of life.

programme.title: Kathleen Madigan: Madigan Again
programme.desc: Her Irish Catholic Midwest family, pills in her mom’s purse, touring Afghanistan, an unparalleled love of John Denver…are all fodder for this special.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Guess How Much?
programme.desc: Yang dives into love languages, loser friends and negotiating with his Asian parents.

programme.title: Jimmy O. Yang: Good Deal
programme.desc: The Silicon Valley star uses his debut stand-up special to discuss tall women, disappointing his parents, and how he learned English from rap videos.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Black Famous
programme.desc: This last year has been unlike any other: COVID, lockdowns, and for Gary, it has also included a divorce and family insanity unlike any other; up until now, Gary hasn't been able to speak about what really happened.

programme.title: Gary Owen: #DoinWhatIDo
programme.desc: The so-called “Funniest Serviceman in America” draws from his multiracial experience to lambast culture wars on social media and in his own home.

programme.title: Gary Owen: Breakin' Out the Park
programme.desc: In this brutally honest stand-up performance, comedian Gary Owen confesses his hilarious history of growing up in and around trailer parks.

programme.title: Kabir Singh: Retiring Material
programme.desc: The energetic and hilariously perplexed comedian Kabir Singh discusses the hilarity of daily life, including bizarre Halloween costumes.

programme.title: Orlando Baxter: Glorified Baby Sitter
programme.desc: Boston-area comic Orlando Baxter stars in this stand-up set that goes back to his days as a teacher, shopping while Black, and laughs about life.

programme.title: Ward Anderson: Kind Of...Sort Of...Grown Up
programme.desc: Comedian Ward Anderson ponders baby monitors, spam messages, ruining hotel beds, sexual tension, and men’s reactions to witnessing childbirth.

programme.title: Tim Wilkins: Password Protected
programme.desc: The dream comes alive for a TV and radio personality, speaker and writer and 20-year veteran of stand-up comedy who has performed around the world.

programme.title: Brian Gaar: Jokes I Wrote at Work
programme.desc: In his first hour-long comedy special, Twitter sensation Brian Gaar tackles everything from the challenges of fatherhood to trying to keep his gamer cred in his 30s. Filmed live at the Spider House Ballroom in Austin, Texas.

programme.title: Andy Erikson: Unicorn Style
programme.desc: The stand up comedian discusses her epic stint in college dressing up as a car, her unconventional takeaway on Noah’s Arc, and more.

programme.title: Andrew Santino: Homefield Advantage
programme.desc: The comedian Andrew Santino goes home to Chicago for a comedy special, riffing on topics like bachelorette parties, severe acne, and his childhood.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Clear
programme.desc: Comedian D.L. Hughley comments on current political events and hot topics, from marijuana legalization to the advantages of intrusive white neighbors.

programme.title: D.L. Hughley: Reset
programme.desc: Notable standup comedian D.L. Hughley skewers current political events, his own family issues, and more in this hilarious standup special.

programme.title: Gary Gulman: In This Economy?
programme.desc: In this stand-up special, money is a wellspring for the comedy of funnyman Gary Gulman, who aims darts at the überwealthy -- including Donald Trump.

programme.title: Finesse Mitchell: The Spirit Told Me to Tell You
programme.desc: The Saturday Night Live alum discusses acclimating to the Los Angeles attitude, night clubs, and how he keeps his marriage healthy.

programme.title: Karen Morgan: Go Dawgs!
programme.desc: Former trial attorney Karen Morgan moved from the courtroom to comedy after being a finalist on Nickelodeon’s Search for the Funniest Mom in America.

programme.title: Key Lewis: Half Black Half White Looks Mexican
programme.desc: Relationships are anything but sacred, for this California-bred, high energy, musical, improvisational, storytelling, multiple-personality nutcase!

programme.title: Josh Sneed: Live in the Dessert
programme.desc: Hailing from the great city of Cincinnati, Josh Sneed comes to Dry Bar bringing “new life” to comedy. Being funny 24/7 is hard, but he pulls it off.

programme.title: Leanne Morgan: So Yummy
programme.desc: The stand up comic discusses dogs, cheerleading camp, the struggles of being an empty nester, and joining Weight Watchers for the 7th time.

programme.title: Maria Bamford: The Special Special Special
programme.desc: The comic performs for an audience consisting of only her parents.

programme.title: Tammy Pescatelli: Finding the Funny
programme.desc: The hilarious and sometimes humiliating aspects of domestic life, including marriage and in-laws, are the focus of this comedy special.

programme.title: Todd Glass Talks About Stuff
programme.desc: In this caustic comedy special, veteran stand-up quipster Todd Glass makes audiences howl with his take on some of society's unspoken "rules," from complimenting kids to giving directions.

programme.desc: Mark adjusts to his first day of college as a commuter student.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene crashes Mark’s college trivia night to prove how smart she is.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene urges Ben to make some male friends as he feels anxious about turning 50.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The hardware store suffers a smash and grab and Dan and Jackie hold one of the culprits.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene seeks to be manager of food services at Mark’s college after feeling they could use some organization.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners relish national cheeseball day. Harris falls behind in her work at the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is asked to write an article for a Hardware magazine, making Ben miss his days as a writer.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A fire at Ben’s hardware store causes a major setback for the family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan achieves a major financial milestone, reconsidering his belief in the ‘Conners curse.’

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mark takes on odd jobs, determined to find a way to pay for school.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A sudden turn of events forces the Conners to face their daily struggles in a way they never have before.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene is in for one surprise after another when David introduces his girlfriend, Blue (Juliette Lewis), and mentions that Mark and Harris will be spending the weekend with them.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: It's Halloween, the favorite time of year for the Conners, but an email from the school banning certain costumes, including Mark's, sets off an argument between Dan and Darlene.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Geena learns D.J. hasn't been taking Mary to church while she's been away, so she insists they go as a family.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: A family member drops a life-changing announcement; Dan suspects that Becky isn't sticking to her end of the deal about her drinking; Darlene continues her job search.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: With Mark and Mary's help, Jackie convinces Dan to build a chicken coop so the family can eat organic eggs.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan questions Peter's motives when he learns about the pricey Christmas gift Jackie bought for her new unemployed beau. Elsewhere, Mark and Mary write up their Christmas wish list.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Becky helps Harris keep a secret from Darlene, it causes a split between the two sisters.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Dan gets injured on the job covering D.J.'s vending machine route, the choice to sue the company could lead to D.J. getting fired.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: When Ben offers Mark free piano lessons, Darlene finds this as an opportunity to test his parenting skills. Meanwhile, Jackie throws Becky a baby shower.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: As Darlene grapples with a life-altering offer, a conversation with David turns her world more upside-down.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: After Emilio's deportation, Jackie takes on a paternal role crafting a birth plan for Becky; Darlene navigates a love triangle with David and Ben; Harris faces her own dilemma.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene struggles to decide between David and Ben; Becky begins to doubt herself as a mom; Mark gets in trouble at school when a picture of him and his boyfriend kissing goes viral

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris confronts Darlene's lifestyle; Jackie meddles in others' affairs to evade her own issues; Becky struggles with the expenses of parenthood, her family lends support.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Becky applies for a bartending job at Casita Bonita; Dan is concerned it could worsen her drinking.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: At Halloween, Jackie learns a shocking secret while trying to reopen the Lunch Box.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie and Becky pitch their business plan to Darlene in hopes of getting the Lunch Box back, but Darlene's decision leads to hostility among the three.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Thanksgiving chaos erupts as Dan gathers the family; tensions rise over the Lunch Box; Harris surprises everyone with a bold move.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Jackie’s faced with a tough decision that brings the family and community together.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan is disappointed when everyone but Becky forgets about his birthday; Darlene faces another issue; Dan excludes Jackie from the family Christmas Santa photo for mistreating Louis

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners resist Becky's Packers fan boyfriend; Dan emphasizes family loyalty to the Bears to Mark; Ben and Darlene seek a loan for their magazine.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene’s thrilled when Harris gets into Central Illinois State, but she may have other plans.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners debate voting reasons; Louise's offer threatens to take her from Lanford, prompting family intervention in Dan's relationship.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan avoids grief until it confronts him; Ben and Darlene tackle baby fever; Dwight's nervous to fill in for an injured chef.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan connects with his half-brother but struggles with their father's unequal treatment; Jackie hits it off with a fun married couple.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene joins Price Warehouse for income; Jackie advances her relationship with Ron and Janelle; Ben alters his appearance for advertisers.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Harris returns home newly-unemployed; Becky seeks childcare; Jackie advises reaching out to Emilio's family; the family ponders tattoos.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Bev returns, wants to spread happiness with her money. She offers to fund Mark's coding camp tuition, but Darlene suggests giving it to Harris.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan’s ready to share his feelings with Louise; Darlene realizes how badly she wants a baby.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Dan and Louise deepen their bond amid the challenges of aging; Darlene's night in jail leaves Ben in charge of parenting; Mark's class experiment with a friend results in hickeys.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Darlene and Ben hunt for apartments; Jackie, Becky, and Beverly Rose road trip to Mexico to meet her father; Dan confides financial woes to Louise.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: The Conners are dealing with the pandemic and life's financial troubles; the Lunch Box is closed for everything but takeout and delivery.

programme.title: The Conners
programme.desc: Mary is devastated that Halloween has been canceled by the city, so Darlene and Becky enlist Jackie and the rest of the family to create an unforgettable experience.

programme.title: The Conners

programme.desc: With 26 sealed briefcases full of varying amounts of cash, ranging from a penny to $1m - contestants decide whether to accept an offer of cash from 'the Banker,' in exchange for what might be contained in the contestant's chosen briefcase.

programme.title: Baggage
programme.desc: Contestants on this dating game show don't want to hear the elimination line "I'm sorry, but you have too much baggage." How much is acceptable among three contestants in each episode is determined by the "dater," who hears the candidates' intimate secrets and hidden flaws, as well as their attempts to deflect these traits by describing their positive attributes. After two elimination rounds leave one remaining contestant, it's the dater's turn to reveal his or her own baggage ... and then the contestant decides to go forward with the date or not. Jerry Springer hosts.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s no doubt that the ‘Ball Crusher’ Sweeper is the star of tonight’s show. With a brother- sister team hanging by a thread and a three-way hurdle, this week’s Sweeper writes itself into the History books. Tonight is also the night we meet Buffman, a pint sized Superhero with a twitch and a photo finish at the Dizzy Dummy threatens extinction to a Rare Breed. A week of action packed Wipeouts with Latin Dancing lotharios, what more can you ask for? And for the kids, a Fairy Tale, Wipeout Style!

programme.desc: Buoys, Field Goal Swing, Big Donuts and Tippy Tables are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team celebrate the wonder of trees and explore the vital role they play in gardens and the wider landscape. Zoe Ball joins Toby Buckland on a visit to a tree project in North London.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is at Longmeadow, preparing for the seasons to come. He demonstrates a quick and easy way to prune shrub roses and then plants up pots that will flower in time for Christmas. Grasses look their best at the end of summer and Carol Klein visits a garden in Somerset where they have been used to maximum effect on a sloping site with a range of soil conditions.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don is back at the helm, but this time in the garden at his own Herefordshire home - a place that he has lovingly nurtured for the last 20 years. With winter receding, Monty, Carol Klein, Joe Swift and Rachel de Thame are preparing for spring. As well as showing us round his garden, Monty lifts and divides snowdrops and sows beetroot and plants onions. Monty also prunes his apple trees and trims his shrub roses.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares for his spring display and tackles slippery paths, Carol Klein visits a collection of Michaelmas daisies and we visit a veg grower with a show-stopping Halloween pumpkin.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the last programme of the current series, Monty Don takes stock of his year at Longmeadow. We visit RHS Wisley to learn why autumn leaves are such a precious commodity for our gardens, and in the final instalment of her botany series, Carol Klein celebrates the glorious displays put on by flowering plants to attract pollinators.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don visits two sets of ambitious gardeners, each facing challenges on a very different scale. One is a tiny urban courtyard in Hackney and the other is a outdoor area for a community.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty meets two sets of gardeners who have unimaginable ambitions for their outdoor spaces. In Essex Denise has never ventured beyond the decking area behind her house. Meanwhile in Ipswich, a father and daughter plan to build a terraced allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty comes to the rescue of two couples in need of help transforming their rubble filled back gardens into havens of peace and tranquillity. They are in serious need of help and advice but can Monty set them on the right track?

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Starting his journey at the sole surviving garden of the 1600s, Levens Hall in Cumbria, Monty sets out to investigate what the gardens of this age would have looked like and what influenced and inspired their creation.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty bases himself at Rousham House in Oxfordshire, designed by one of the first practitioners of the landscape movement, William Kent. It has survived almost unchanged since its completion in 1741.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don explores the extraordinary transformations that occurred throughout the 19th century. As a result of an expanding empire, scientific and technological innovation and social change, British gardens became more exotic, more colourful and more widely accessible than ever before.

programme.title: The Secret History of the British Garden
programme.desc: Monty Don concludes his journey through Britain's gardening heritage by looking at how the nation's gardens have evolved over the last hundred years. He looks at the profound effect that two world wars had on the attitude to gardens and gardening.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Morocco, Monty discovers the wide variety of paradise gardens. He begins just outside the city of Marrakesh in an enormous royal walled meadow, The Agdal. From there he moves to the heart of the town where he comes upon a tiny garden where huge banana plants jostle with palms to create a secret paradise garden, a shelter from the busy world outside. And in another part of the city a rundown old palace has been turned into a stunning contemporary garden with a twist.

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don returns to Japan during the fiery blaze of autumn. He visits the three great gardens of Japan to learn how they protect the garden from the coming winter and learns how the Japanese are weaving nature into their concrete urban jungle.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: As the winter draws to a close, work in the garden starts to step up gear. With the flowers and fruits of summer in mind, Monty Don gets going by planting pots of summer bulbs for colour and scent, passing on his secrets of success by using a variety of planting techniques. He also reveals plans for reinvigorating the area in his garden where perennials are planted. Plus, Carol Klein visits Glendurgan Garden in Cornwall.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don prepares the flowering borders for winter and makes a bonfire, Carol celebrates our berry-laden hedgerows, and Rachel visits Julian Clary in his garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is back at Longmeadow, getting stuck into more seasonal tasks. Joe Swift heads to Houghton Lodge Gardens in Hampshire renowned for its walled kitchen garden and heritage fruit collection.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty is preparing for spring colour as well as harvesting pumpkins and squashes. Carol Klein visits comedian Joe Lycett at home, and together, they plant up a container packed with layers of colourful bulbs. Toby Buckland visits Sue Kent's garden near Swansea to help out with autumnal maintenance.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and team share the best practical gardening advice, meet passionate plants-people up and down the country, and provide inspiration with visits to some of the UK's most remarkable gardens.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With spring just around the corner, Monty makes a start on his bog garden and demonstrates how to divide perennials and get plants for free. Rachel de Thame visits a garden in Kent, a labour of love where meticulous planning, discipline and precision have cleverly extended the season, and Arit Anderson plants up a seasonal container inspired by the colours of spring.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty gets stuck into some seasonal jobs at Longmeadow. Nick Bailey heads to Bodnant Garden in north Wales to find out how the team are tackling the recent storm damage and what new planting opportunities have been created.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty and the team focus their attention on the loss of wildflower habitats in the UK and the part that gardeners can play in averting the resulting loss of wildlife. Adam Frost is in Lincolnshire to find out how crucial meadows are to supporting an ecosystem.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: After an extraordinary season, Monty's orchard has a bountiful harvest of apples and he gives advice on how to pick and store them. Frances Tophill makes a final visit to her shared allotment and joins in with the festivities at their annual show. Adam Frost visits the RHS garden Wisley where he meets the Curator to discuss the effects of summer. Nick Bailey investigates knotweed, one of the most pernicious weeds in the UK, Arit Anderson provides inspiration for colourful late season containers.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don takes some practical steps to protect tender plants as the first frosts of the year begin to bite. He also starts preparing for next spring, planting tulips, pansies and apple trees and sharing his advice on training step-over apples and planting out wallflowers from seed. Meanwhile, Carol Klein is at Glebe Cottage demonstrating how to grow plants from cuttings.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don visits some of the most famous and interesting gardens in France. Here, he tells the stories behind France's important historic gardens. These include elaborate walled gardens designed to please the mistress - and then the wife - of a King, and magnificent displays of flowers and fountains that involved thousands of soldiers moving tracts of land and incited violent jealousy in another monarch.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don turns to the French love of food and finds out how this has influenced their gardens. He travels to some of the most famous `potager' or kitchen gardens, where vegetables and flowers are planted together in elaborate and beautiful displays. He also talks to gardeners about this style of planting which has been copied the world over.

programme.title: Monty Don's French Gardens
programme.desc: Monty Don travels to some of the most celebrated artists' gardens, including the one created by the impressionist Claude Monet, who planted and painted his garden for half his life. Monty also matches the paintings to the garden of Paul Cezanne, as well as visiting several contemporary artistic gardens to see how the use of plants and trees has evolved into new and varied styles.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Two gardeners, each living on their own, are hoping Monty can help them. In Blackpool, Alex dreams of turning her boring back yard into a magical enchanted forest. Also in Bristol, Ross has taken on a very over-grown allotment.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: In Leyton, Tariq and Sairah want to turn their dumping ground of a back yard into a sumptuous award-winning garden, suitable for entertaining friends and family. Both have competitive jobs in the banking sector and are used to winning at work but when it comes to gardening, they don't know where to begin.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels from Missouri to Chicago and then across to New York and Philadelphia. He begins his journey in a prairie, the original American flowering wilderness. Much of the prairie has disappeared but he meets a couple who have revived the tradition and enjoy showing it to him in full bloom.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty goes South to explore gardens of early independent America and learns how the history of this part of the country is still very much evident in the places and people he meets. He visits the famous garden where President Thomas Jefferson, one of America's founding fathers, enjoyed spending his time seeking out seeds and plants for his thousand foot vegetable garden.

programme.title: Monty Don's American Gardens
programme.desc: Monty explores the extraordinary scenery of the west coast of America. He begins his journey in Arizona where he learns about cacti and marvels at the sight of them in the desert and in private gardens where they have replaced traditional plants and lawns.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty welcomes spring at Longmeadow with plenty of changes in the garden to share. As well as getting on with some essential pruning, he lifts and divides perennials, starts sowing chillies and begins growing this year's vegetables.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty harvests his favourite winter veg, Joe Swift discovers AJ Odudu's passion for houseplants, and Sue Kent and Toby Buckland take an inspirational trip to Piet Oudolf's garden in Somerset.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: This time there's plenty to do to prepare for the season to come and Monty Don is clearing out spent crops and mulching his asparagus. Joe Swift's been to visit keen gardeners, Wayne and Geraldine Hemingway, to see how they combine sustainability with their designer-style. Carol Klein's exploring the history of the rose at Coughton Court, one of our best rose gardens and Monty plants a new rose of his own. What happens when you have to downsize and leave your much-loved garden?

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We find ourselves fishing with Troy from Lonestar Beer. Not only is Troy a great friend he is also a big supporter of Hunters Extravaganza. We get to catch up in the offseason and spend a day on the water discussing future events and reflect on what all Texas has to offer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We are blessed today to hunt with Cole Dutton for the Inaugural Pierce Dutton Memorial Hunt. We are honored to spend a weekend with Cole and his family at the G2 Ranch. Disabled Outdoorsman has played a huge part in getting those less fortunate outdoors. We are truly blessed to be able to follow along and capture these great moments.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

programme.title: Browning Films
programme.desc: Slade Northwest heads to Montana for some goose.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: After taking 2 great bucks in Nebraska, the Road Trips crew came back home to Georgia with Tyler and Rigsby taking bucks on back to back sits! Dash makes 3 Georgia bucks in 3 sits!

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan and Michael Pitts try to keep the new season streak going. Things get real in a hurry when Pitts’ encounter doesn’t go as planned.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Join Tyler Jordan, Brandon Sheppard, and Brantley Richardson as they hit the woods in Georgia during the peak of the November rut! Then, Tyler heads to Kansas in search of big Midwestern bucks.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Former MLB superstar Chipper Jones trades the ballfield for Iowa timber—and what happens on his first day is the stuff every bowhunter dreams about.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: Tyler Jordan is back on home turf going after a familiar target — a buck he and the team chased all last season they call the "cover buck." With trail cam pics and history on their side, it’s game on from day one. Tyler also jumps behind the lens to film Rigsby Stewart as he gets a shot at a giant 7-point buck on Realtree Farms.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: When the Bay Point Billfish Open returns, we hop on board the Ellie B for some offshore competition and follow the event’s epic dockside party.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team heads over to FGCI FiberGlass Coatings to learn about their innovative product, Paintable FiberGlass. This will be used to help touch up some scratches in the Taco Marine Project boat. We also receive very helpful maintenance tips to keep you running smoothly when out on the water.

programme.title: Ship Shape TV
programme.desc: During this episode of Ship Shape TV Essentials the SSTV team highlighted deck repair and antique motor restoration, including storage solutions and structural enhancements.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has Slade’s brain in scrambles as he is preparing to head to Iowa after waiting 5 years to finally draw his tag. The chase is on let’s see if the Hunting Land Man can seal a deal!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: A Southwest Mississippi GIANT “Barry” has made more daylight appearances than possibly any mature bucks in existence. Now that Slade is back from the midwest The chase is on.

programme.desc: Capt Justin & Meredith’s beautiful Panama City Beach morning is met with a slack tide so a new path to redfish success is found under a popular bridge.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: If you had a blank check to build the best fishing boat possible, what would you create? Capt. Justin gets his wish, but it doesn’t come quickly or easily.

programme.title: Chasin' The Sun
programme.desc: Capt. Justin takes a fellow guide on his new boat to see how it measures up. Using only public waypoints on his Humminbird unit, they find exploring to be as much fun as it is fruitful.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Josh Dahlke, a lifelong big game hunter, never imagined he would ever get the chance to hunt Rocky Mountain bighorn sheep. But then he found a way. Watch his hunt of a lifetime unfold in the second part of this HuntStand Original Film.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: After a 5-year hiatus from vertical bowhunting, Josh Dahlkegets a phone call from a friend that compels him to pick up a compound bowagain and prepare for a bucket-list hunt. Dahlke and Mike Mattly head to thelegendary Gila region of New Mexico to go after rutting bull elk. But they’reonce again reminded that bowhunting is often a long game, with no guarantees—even if you’re hunting in one of the best elk units in the country

programme.title: HuntStand TIps and Gear
programme.desc: See Muddy’s TRX performance hunting apparel – a full layering system available in three different camo patterns. Plus, get an inside look at Muddy DV8 rubber-neoprene hybrid hunting boots.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Nearly 7 years after her husband’s tragic and unexpected passing, Nana returns to her farm and embraces the healing power of whitetail hunting.
If you hunt big whitetails this is a must see! Follow Adam Hays and Lee Lakosky as they hunt for multiple giants and learn some tactics for harvesting monster whitetails!

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade gives you the grand tour of his home property. Slade’s dream was the same as many others, have a place where he can build a home, raise a family, and also have plenty of room to enjoy the outdoors and chase big rack bucks. Slade gives you a breakdown of how he took his raw tract of land and turned it into a beautiful homestead and outdoor paradise. If you are interested in how you can achieve your dream of raising a family on a dream property, this is the episode for you.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhat’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey has always had one dream as a land owner, and after over a decade of managing his Illinois farm, his dream finally came true—a MEGA 200" giant buck! This story began three years ago when Jeff passed on this deer at just 26 yards. Back then, he was a 175" 4.5-year-old stud, but he took a gamble and let him walk... hoping he’d one day break the magical 200" mark.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch he’s helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed “Buddy.”

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Warb and Nick with The Hunting Public, have two days to hunt Missouri public land at the end of October. After nonstop encounters and wild rut activity, Halloween delivers the chance they’ve been waiting for.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven’s Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Danker of Buckventures, returns to his home state of Oklahoma to chase a legendary buck on the Wallahchie Ranch — the "Big 8". With his bow in hand and one specific target in mind, the crew sets up in a blind for what turns into one of the craziest hunts they've ever experienced.
Follow Adam Hays as he hunts for his 5th 200 Inch deer in his home state of Ohio.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A packed episode with 3 hunts from the Hayworth Family with some wild footage of BIG Whitetails.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are still in Nebraska hunting whitetails and muleys. After Jerry filled the first mule deer tag of the trip, the weather takes a turn for the worst and the deer movement slows down drastically. With just five days left in the trip to come up with a new game plan to figure out these whitetails and Austin's number one target mule deer, Jerry and Austin are worried that they may leave without filling another tag.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew takes you to Alberta for an epic Canada Duck Hunt. Watch as Chad Belding and his crew scout and hunt dry field mallards.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: On his third trip of the season to Kansas, Tyler Jordan finally connects on a big flyer buck with his Hoyt RX-10 in hand. Everything comes together in a heart-pounding moment that bow hunters dream about.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Follow retired veteran Kevin Keim as he embarks on a whitetail deer hunt of a lifetime, awarded through the annual Bucks for the Brave event—an initiative honoring America’s heroes.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: After a great sandhill hunt in Oklahoma, Mark is headed down to Georgia's Lake Seminole. This big body of water houses a large concentration of Canvasbacks during the winter months. It's the first time on the journey that Mark has only gone after one species. The list has a lot of checkmarks now, but this hunt proves to be one of the biggest challenges yet.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Jennifer Brooks has spent her life answering the call to serve. From flying Blackhawk helicopters on multiple combat missions during two tours in Iraq to now serving as an Air Medical Pilot and first responder, her story is one of courage, sacrifice, and humility. In this episode of Storytellers, we join Jennifer in the field for a hunt that offers a rare moment to slow down, reflect, and honor a life dedicated to protecting others.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Missouri Project continues but this time it’s all about the turkey killing. Not only does Slade tag out in Missouri and Iowa, but a good family friend Kyle Hicks and Turkey Man Eddie Salter join in on a few hunts. Also, Slade does work on finding new 1031 tax properties and well as a little control burn.

programme.desc: Mike heads to one of the most prolific fisheries in SW Florida; South Seas Island Resort.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Mike highlights some of the best fishing destinations throughout St. Pete and Clearwater.

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Spring time walleyes are always on the move and trying to find them can be difficult as they seek out warm water and food. Choosing the perfect presentation that can be fished to cover water yet can be fished in a variety of ways is critical - the swim bait fits the bill!

programme.title: Sportsman's Journal
programme.desc: Sara and Tyler head to Cliff Lake Resorts in NW Ontario for big walleyes using a drop shot technique!

programme.desc: A once thriving area for wild oysters finds itself in need of rehabilitation. Danny visits a new oyster farm dedicated to building a healthy oyster population.

programme.desc: Danny finds himself in unfamiliar waters targeting the fish of ten thousand casts.

programme.desc: Capt. Jared Raskob joins his long time friend Capt. Jake Roth for a day of fishing in the Florida Keys.

programme.desc: Mitch Widom, Andy Yaffa, & Chris Hammaway join Capt. Jared Raskob in Los Cabos on the hunt for Striped Marlin Part 2.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode, we will highlight what’s being done in the Florida Keys to protect and save the reefs. We will show innovative solutions researchers have created to protect the coral and showcase the recovery that’s taking place.

programme.title: Destination Dive

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.
Adam and Logan Hays chase big bucks in the Buckeye State!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Every year, hunters from across the country flock to various parts of Texas to extend their hunting season. This year, our friends from Struttinbuck did just the same. Matt and Clede make the long drive to Del Rio to hunt South Texas bucks right on the Mexico border.

programme.title: Dirt
programme.desc: Guadalajara’s heritage runs deep. On the DIRT crew’s latest adventure, they explored the region’s rich history from volcanic highlands to secret surf coves. Chefs Xrysw Ruelas and Óscar Segundo sent Josh and co. to load up on locally grown coffee, spearfish between catching waves, and follow freshly harvested agave on its journey to becoming tequila. After learning the ropes of Mexico’s national sport, Charreria, and hitting up a Lucha Libre match, all the local flavors came together in a feast backed by thousands of years of tradition. There really is something special in the soil here.

Slade gives you a breakdown of how he took his raw tract of land and turned it into a beautiful homestead and outdoor paradise. If you are interested in how you can achieve your dream of raising a family on a dream property, this is the episode for you.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes us through his new investment property, and breaks downwhat’s involved in taking a raw land tract and creating extremely desirable turn-keyhunting properties.Caleb and Slade double up on some Wilkinson County gobblers for Calebs first turkeykill ever.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade and part of the old Trained Assassins Crew, Luke Mitchell (producer) and Ryan Wascom (host), head out to Colorado to chase bugling elk with their bows. Also joining the crew is one of Slade’s real estate clients and his son. Part of the deal when this client worked with Slade was that Slade lined them up an elk hunt the following fall. It is an amazing week at camp with five arrows being sent down range and multiple elk hitting the dirt. You do not want to miss this one.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Long time friends Mike and Danny find a hot top water bite.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Captiva island is the land of giants. Snook, permit and tarpon are on today’s agenda.

programme.title: Reel Animals
programme.desc: Capt. Mike fishes from safety harbor with Capt. Mikey Rogal for the coveted inshore slam.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Lindsey has always had one dream as a land owner, and after over a decade of managing his Illinois farm, his dream finally came true—a MEGA 200" giant buck! This story began three years ago when Jeff passed on this deer at just 26 yards. Back then, he was a 175" 4.5-year-old stud, but he took a gamble and let him walk... hoping he’d one day break the magical 200" mark.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: After years of chasing one of the oldest and most elusive bucks he's ever encountered, Phillip Vanderpool uses the WoodHaven Initmidator grunt call to finally gets his shot at Tinman, a legendary 10.5-year-old buck in Kansas.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Mike Hunsucker of Heartland Bowhunter returns to a familiar ranch he’s helped manage for years, chasing a legendary buck nicknamed “Buddy.”

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: It's a trip back to Southwest Florida to chase after Redfish and Snook. Plus, a special tour of the Costa Custom Boat Factory

programme.title: Life On The Water
programme.desc: Snapper and Grouper out in the Gulf of Mexico are waiting for Brandon Simmons and Eric Davis. They just have to ride the sporty chop to get to them.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Warb and Nick with The Hunting Public, have two days to hunt Missouri public land at the end of October. After nonstop encounters and wild rut activity, Halloween delivers the chance they’ve been waiting for.

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: WoodHaven’s Josh Anderson heads to the Western Plains of Kansas in pursuit of a mature whitetail buck. Because of the wide open terrain, a decoy and blind calling can be very affective because of the visibility. After a few well-timed grunts on the Intimidator grunt call, a shooter buck shows up right at the base of the tree!

programme.title: The WoodHaven Way
programme.desc: Jeff Danker of Buckventures, returns to his home state of Oklahoma to chase a legendary buck on the Wallahchie Ranch — the "Big 8". With his bow in hand and one specific target in mind, the crew sets up in a blind for what turns into one of the craziest hunts they've ever experienced.
Follow Adam Hays as he hunts for his 5th 200 Inch deer in his home state of Ohio.

programme.title: HuntStand Presents
programme.desc: Hunting has a way of grounding us, reminding us of what truly matters: shared moments and unforgettable memories. Chance and Ashleigh Eckert are on their first out-of-state hunt in the rolling hills of Ohio. After overcoming a life-changing kidney transplant, their story is one of faith, love, and resilience. While the goal was a big buck, the true reward was the time spent together and the lessons learned along the way. Because hunting is about so much more than the harvest — it’s about the journey.

programme.title: Canadian Whitetail
programme.desc: A packed episode with 3 hunts from the Hayworth Family with some wild footage of BIG Whitetails.

programme.title: Bearded Buck
programme.desc: In this episode, Jerry and Austin are still in Nebraska hunting whitetails and muleys. After Jerry filled the first mule deer tag of the trip, the weather takes a turn for the worst and the deer movement slows down drastically. With just five days left in the trip to come up with a new game plan to figure out these whitetails and Austin's number one target mule deer, Jerry and Austin are worried that they may leave without filling another tag.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The guys move across the south hunting ducks in Texas and Oklahoma ahead of a major push of cold weather across the country.

programme.title: Black Cloud
programme.desc: The Black Cloud crew takes you to Alberta for an epic Canada Duck Hunt. Watch as Chad Belding and his crew scout and hunt dry field mallards.

programme.title: Realtree Road Trips
programme.desc: On his third trip of the season to Kansas, Tyler Jordan finally connects on a big flyer buck with his Hoyt RX-10 in hand. Everything comes together in a heart-pounding moment that bow hunters dream about.

programme.title: Realtree Roadtrips
programme.desc: Riley Green heads down to South Louisiana to finish out duck and deer season. The first morning duck hunt was absolutely epic with a 7 man limit at 7:35 am. Day 3 in the deer blind proved to be all Riley needed to close out his deer season with a big, wide 10 point!

programme.title: Winchester Life
programme.desc: Melissa Bachman has made her name over the last two decades as one of the most dedicated hunters and producers in the outdoor industry. In this episode we’ll tag along with Melissa while she chases big game around the world with her Winchester in hand. First, we’ll head to Prince of Whales Island as Melissa tries to catch up to a giant black bear, then travel across the pond to chase mountain ibex, New Zealand for tar, and back to the states for whitetail.

programme.title: Deer and Deer Hunting
programme.desc: Follow retired veteran Kevin Keim as he embarks on a whitetail deer hunt of a lifetime, awarded through the annual Bucks for the Brave event—an initiative honoring America’s heroes.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: After a great sandhill hunt in Oklahoma, Mark is headed down to Georgia's Lake Seminole. This big body of water houses a large concentration of Canvasbacks during the winter months. It's the first time on the journey that Mark has only gone after one species. The list has a lot of checkmarks now, but this hunt proves to be one of the biggest challenges yet.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: It is Mark Peterson’s third day in Mexico hunting for a Mexican Texanus Whitetail. After bagging two big bucks in just two days with his new Gunwerks Nexus 300 PRC, he is now moving to a new farm where a giant 12-point buck has often been seen in the southeast corner of the property. It’s the coldest day since he arrived, which typically means the deer will be more active. He is thrilled at the prospect of what could be the best day yet. If everything goes well, they will spend the evening hunting hogs from the high rack.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Jennifer Brooks has spent her life answering the call to serve. From flying Blackhawk helicopters on multiple combat missions during two tours in Iraq to now serving as an Air Medical Pilot and first responder, her story is one of courage, sacrifice, and humility. In this episode of Storytellers, we join Jennifer in the field for a hunt that offers a rare moment to slow down, reflect, and honor a life dedicated to protecting others.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: We love our college chapters. Hudson has been a long time member of TTHA as well as serving with the Texas A&M Chapter. We have a great time at G2 in pursuit of Axis deer.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: In 2010, Amberly Snyder’s life changed forever when an accident left her paralyzed from the waist-down. Her comeback story not unlike something you’d see in a movie…in fact it inspired one. Disabled Outdoorsmen USA contacted TTHA and set up this hunt and we were fortunate enough to be able to capture just some of Amberly’s story and her harvest of a beautiful Axis buck at the G2 Ranch in the spring of 2022.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: Missouri Project continues but this time it’s all about the turkey killing. Not only does Slade tag out in Missouri and Iowa, but a good family friend Kyle Hicks and Turkey Man Eddie Salter join in on a few hunts. Also, Slade does work on finding new 1031 tax properties and well as a little control burn.

programme.desc: Spring time walleyes are always on the move and trying to find them can be difficult as they seek out warm water and food. Choosing the perfect presentation that can be fished to cover water yet can be fished in a variety of ways is critical - the swim bait fits the bill!

programme.desc: Sara and Tyler head to Cliff Lake Resorts in NW Ontario for big walleyes using a drop shot technique!

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: In this episode we explore the wrecks and reefs that make Marathon one of the top dive destinations in the world. We will highlight what being done buy groups to restore our fragile coral reefs.

programme.title: Destination Dive
programme.desc: On this show we will explore the crystal-clear waters of Islamorada to experience all this area has to offer. We will highlight the critical roll sharks play in our eco system and what is being done to protect them.

programme.title: Destination Dive

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green and his buddy Jeremy set out on a buffalo hunt in the great state of Oklahoma. Along the way they learn about the true past and potential future of the American Buffalo from several interesting people with different perspectives.

programme.title: The Green Way Outdoors
programme.desc: Kyle Green heads to Yankton, South Dakota to learn about the history of the Missouri river and the people who count on the river for sustenance. The invasive carp are set to destroy this rich ecosystem and Kyle aims to stop this fish with his best weapon, a great recipe.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: With Montana in the rearview mirror the Flylords team crosses over into Idaho. In this leg of the trip they hit Blue-Ribbon trout waters with the folks from Henrys Fork Anglers and Silver Creek Outfitters. They also have a chance to sit down with the owners of these operations and hear what these shops and fly fishing mean to them. Before they hit the road to Utah the crew joins in on another conservation event at Payette Brewing Company.

programme.title: Fly Shop Tour
programme.desc: It’s the final leg of the Fly Shop Tour and what better way to end it than with a trip down to see the crew at Fly Fish Food. We learn the unique story of how owners Clark “Cheech” Pierce & Curtis Fry started their shop and spend some time chasing hungry Cutthroat. Wrapping it all up the team puts on the final conservation event of the season with Fly Fish Food and Fish For Garbage, as well as spending some time behind the oars on the Green River with crew at Western Rivers Fly Shop.

programme.title: Hunting Land Man
programme.desc: In this episode, Slade takes you on a ride through one of the coolest cities in the south, the historic Natchez, Mississippi. This is an area in which Slade sells a lot of hunting land and being only 40 minutes from where he grew up, Slade is very familiar with all there is to do in the area not only from a recreational standpoint but also for entertainment. Slade takes you through the showing process on a beautiful piece of property and bring it full circle at the closing. You’ll also watch a deer hunt with Slade in Natchez that was featured on Realtree Monster Bucks DVD. This is a jampacked episode with so much to learn and also enjoy. We know you’ll love it.

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: As part of this year's Star brite Sea Safe event, we hit the water to experience some of the incredible fishing the Indian River Lagoon has to offer. For Rush, that meant some serious bow time with close friend Alex Hughey - on the hunt for some of the biggest snook we've ever encountered. The bite wasn't easy, but that didn't stop Rush from smashing his personal best - not once, but twice - in one unforgettable day on the water. Don't miss this action-packed episode of the Sea Safe adventure from beautiful Sebastian, Florida!

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: Join Rush and his good friend Anthony Solmo for an epic day of fishing in the stunning waters of Key West, Florida! Leaving the Odyssea at the dock, they hop on a bay boat outfitted with a trolling motor for the ultimate inshore adventure. Gliding quietly through the shallows, they target a variety of species—including hard-pulling Tarpon and explosive topwater Jacks—leaving Rush thinking, “A guy could get used to this kind of fishing!”

programme.title: Local Knowledge
programme.desc: SoCal summer is calling, and the Local Knowledge crew is back on Ali’s home turf in San Diego, California. With reports of hot bites and fish moving in, the crew faces a classic Southern California dilemma — chase big yellowtail around the Coronado Islands or head north in search of bluefin tuna. The options are plenty, the challenges are real, and that’s exactly what keeps fishing in SoCal so exciting.
